books.title: The Georgics
books.author: Virgil
books.summary: Virgil explores rural life, providing practical advice on agriculture, arboriculture, viticulture, animal husbandry, and beekeeping.

books.title: Treasure Island
books.author: Robert Louis Stevenson
books.summary: A young boy finds adventure on the high seas as he battles bloodthirsty pirates in search of a long-lost treasure.

books.title: The Enormous Room
books.author: E. E. Cummings
books.summary: E. E. Cummings describes the experiences of his and his fellow inmates’ imprisonment during World War I.

books.title: A General History of the Pirates
books.author: Captain Charles Johnson
books.summary: The lives and stories of the daring pirate outlaws who terrorized the Atlantic Ocean and Caribbean Sea in the 18th century.

books.title: The Secret of the Caves
books.author: Franklin W. Dixon
books.summary: Four boys vacation at nearby caves only to be swept up in a mystery.

books.title: A Gentleman of Leisure
books.author: P. G. Wodehouse
books.summary: Jimmy Pitt gets much more than he bargained for when he bets his friends at the Strollers’ Club that he can successfully burgle a house.

books.title: The Power of Darkness
books.author: Leo Tolstoy
books.summary: Two Russian peasants tragically succumb to selfish, immoral temptations.

books.title: The Chessmen of Mars
books.author: Edgar Rice Burroughs
books.summary: Tara, Princess of Helium and daughter of John Carter, finds life-threatening adventure in thrilling far-off regions of Barsoom.

books.title: Sir Percy Hits Back
books.author: Baroness Orczy
books.summary: A young woman doing a good deed is inadvertently caught up in the injustice of the French Revolution.

books.title: The Magician
books.author: W. Somerset Maugham
books.summary: A young engaged couple meet a mysterious man who claims to have practical knowledge of the occult.

books.title: Running a Thousand Miles for Freedom
books.author: William Craft
books.summary: The authors escape from slavery by posing as a slaveowner and his slave.

books.title: The D’Arblay Mystery
books.author: R. Austin Freeman
books.summary: A doctor finds himself entangled in the mysterious death of an artist after discovering his body in a secluded pond.

books.title: Struggles and Triumphs
books.author: P. T. Barnum
books.summary: The world’s greatest showman tells the story of his life.

books.title: The Crock of Gold
books.author: James Stephens
books.summary: A philosopher sets out to rescue the beautiful Caitilin Ni Murrachu from the god Pan in an adventure that involves leprechauns, Celtic gods, policemen, and philosophical disquisitions both profound and absurd.

books.title: Poetry
books.author: Fernando Pessoa
books.summary: A collection of Fernando Pessoa’s poetry.

books.title: Penguin Island
books.author: Anatole France
books.summary: A myopic saint mistakenly baptizes some penguins, ushering in a centuries-spanning satire of French history.

books.title: Short Fiction
books.author: Walter M. Miller Jr.
books.summary: A collection of short fiction by Walter M. Miller Jr., ordered by date of original publication.

books.title: School Stories
books.author: P. G. Wodehouse
books.summary: A collection of Wodehouse’s school stories about the lives and adventures of schoolboys in the early 1900s.

books.title: Paradise Lost
books.author: John Milton
books.summary: A dramatic imagining in blank verse of the rebellion of Satan against God, Satan’s overthrow, and the Fall of Man.

books.title: Three Men in a Boat
books.author: Jerome K. Jerome
books.summary: The humorous travelogue of a boating holiday down the Thames taken by three friends and their dog.
